summary: The IRS's Large Business and International division audits large partnerships and corporations (worth at least $10 million) and wealthy individuals—which sometimes poses compliance challenges. For example, the underreported income tax of corporations alone was about $28 million annually between 2008 and 2010. This division is implementing a new approach to compliance that focuses on specific issues, such as partnerships that underreport certain types of income...
title: IRS Return Selection: Improved Planning, Internal Controls, and Data Would Enhance Large Business Division Efforts to Implement New Compliance Approach
